Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture Speed, HD Movie Taking and Crystal Clear Pics
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small point & shoot camera that would be easy to take with me, that had a great optical zoom, that took HD movies and most importantly could take quick pictures. I tried out many cameras in stores before finding this one and so far have been very, very pleased.  I am able to quickly capture my kids smiles and the pictures are super clear.  Plus, you are able to zoom while in movie mode.  The 7x optical zoom is fantastic.  I love that I can touch up photos right on the camera and right from the get go the camera was easy to use.  I find that the buttons are set up very well in a user friendly manner.

Reviews.Title: Another wonderful camera from Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Margaret Granado
Reviews.Content: This is my third in the Nikon Coolpix line, and I love it just as much as my previous ones! If you're a fan of any Nikon Coolpix, this will certainly be something you like!My only disappointment is that there isn't a "Sports" setting anymore, which was something I used a lot on my older models. However, the camera takes such fast pictures that it hasn't really become a problem as of yet.Battery life is good... haven't taken the time to see how many pictures it has per charge, but it's held up through at least 200 pictures at a graduation I went to recently without any battery indications.The charger is different than previous the Nikon Coolpix cameras I've owned, as it plugs directly into the camera as opposed to having to remove the battery. I'm not sure whether I like this, because the AC OUT cover is kind of stubborn to come out. Again, it's nothing that's become a problem.The HD movie is pretty cool. I haven't recording much with it, but the quality on it is wonderful. The record button is on the back of the camera, by the menu, which makes it extremely easy to switch from camera to movie. No setting change! This is definitely one of my favorite features, and is perfect if you like to take both stills and video!The zoom is great, and takes crisp shots from a good distance!The smart portrait feature is fun, but probably not something I'll really use. It's a good replacement if you don't want to use the self-timer, but again, it's kind of a pointless feature. Still interesting, though.I haven't played with the Subject Tracker yet, to be honest. I'll add more to this once I get a chance to mess around with it for a little while.Overall, it's a great camera! Not too heavy, though certainly a little bulkier and heavier than my previous Coolpix camera. Hope this helped!***EDIT 7/24/10Okay, after playing with the HD movie, I must say that it's pretty great if you don't mind that it plays on quicktime. The quality is amazing... hard to imagine a digital camera could make video this clear! The Quicktime thing is fairly annoying, and makes editing stuff in Movie Maker a pain, since you have to use a media converter to change the format.I did find out the sports feature does still exist, though not in the same place it has been on my previous Nikon Coolpix cameras. You have to use the menu settings and go under continuous - Sports. A little inconvenient, but I was happy to find it is still on the camera!The battery life is amazing. I took around 900 pictures in one night, as well as 15 minutes of movie and it is still not in need of a charge! With as many pictures as I take, battery life is a BIG thing for me!Overall, I still think it's a wonderful camera and still recommend it after a few months of constant use. Nikon never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s6000
Reviews.Author: Kerrie Chambers "ariesmac"
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks! The pictures are so crystal clear that it is like looking at them in person! I also like the 7x optical zoom, which you are able to use during video recording. It has easy buttons to operate and there are tons of options to play with and very user friendly. It also takes close-up pictures up to 3mm that are NOT blurry! It has lots of options to have automatically set and very easy to switch to when chanigng scenery or from portrait to landscape. It also has the option of choosing one of your own pics as a screen saver every time you turn on the camera. I like that I can change colors of photos (i.e. black & white, sepia) with the press of a button or use the "vivid color" option. It has a great stabilizer and facial recognition software to remove red eye, tell you when someone has blinked in a pic or can soften skin in a photo. I also have a Fuji Finepix SLR camera, but wanted a smaller point and shoot camera for my honeymoon to Alaska this summmer and I am psyched to use this one!

Reviews.Title: Always Canon...First Nikon
Reviews.Author: Biomedman
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but this'll be brief.  I decided to try a Nikon after many, many years of Canon usage (still have several). This Nikon S6000 seemed like a lot of bang for the buck. My impressions so far:Pro's: Great pics, small size, easy to use, great macro, automatic scene selection, good focal lengthCon's: Power button too small, takes WAY too long to zoom after turning on, zoom is in large jerky steps so it's hard to find that "right" framing, poor battery/SD cover design - have to latch the door all the time (not spring loaded), flash use not always predictable in certain light.Would I buy it again?  Probably not...YMMV

Reviews.Title: Luv2travel
Reviews.Author: A. Pennington "luv2travel"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before my 2 week trip to Italy.  My previous camera was a 2002 Nikon Coolpix 3500 which I liked but was outdated.  This camera is a big improvement.  And I used the video feature while on a boat along the Cinque Terre coast!  It did a great job and I have a nice memory of that beautiful coast line.The only thing I don't like is that it makes you charge the battery inside of the camera.  But I only had to recharge the camera twice in 2 weeks and took almost 400 pictures and videos.  So very happy with the battery power.This camera is much lighter than my old camera and I love that.  Very easy to handle and learn how to use;  menus are intuitive.  New features for me that I really like is the panorama shots and the auto selector.  Didn't have these on the 3500.Overall I love this camera but then I'm not looking for SLR quality.  My main use is for travel photos.

Reviews.Title: So Small And Yet . . .
Reviews.Author: Joseph Albanese "The Joe Show"
Reviews.Content: Don't let the size of this little fellow fool you. Although basically a point-and-shoot, this small camera produces pictures that are comparable to the bigger models.In fact, it was a bigger model that led me to the COOLPIX S6000. I own, and love, my Nikon D300. The pictures it takes are nothing short of amazing. However, the weight and bulk of it sometimes get in the way of life. Sure you shoot pictures that are professional but there are times when you need to capture the moment but not with all the creative functionality weighing you down. That's where the S6000 shines. The Nikon technology and genius with photography are evident with the end product. True, you don't get to compensate for a lot of things and the price is a bit stiff for a second camera but it is one that you will use continually - either by itself or one that is easier to transport.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Yat H. Chow
Reviews.Content: I was looking for small camera that does good video; to replace my Canon SD850.  The SD850 was nice but the video is bit fuzzy, specially with zooming.  The S6000 does very good job with the video, and in HD 780 mode.  I replayed the video on my HD TV and found it very detail and just like a regular HD movie.  The picture quality is very detail and sharp.  I have several printouts, Canon appears to be 'warm' comparing to the Nikon's.  Switching different mode is easy enough, you don't need to dig down the menu to find whatever you need. I like the scroll view when viewing stored pictures.  The videos are saved in MOV file, I view it with VLC Media player; I haven't bother to load the software came with the camera.  You do need to buy your own min-HDMI cable but it is not that expensive.  The only thing I don't really like is that you cannot use the zoom while in video mode.  So set up the zoom level before start recording because you cannot change it once recording started.  Also, don't use the continuous focus feature on video, it will try to refocus and miss the subject.  Fix the focus on video and it will do very well.

Reviews.Title: Best Mother's Day Gift!
Reviews.Author: N. Tsukada
Reviews.Content: I got this for mother's day and I absolutely love it. It is really easy to maneuver through even though there are a LOT of functions! I really wanted the touch screen of the 4000s, but I'm glad I got this one. The scroll wheel is really convenient! The colors are vibrant. It's really hard to get a bad picture with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great size, cheap materials.
Reviews.Author: Casper29
Reviews.Content: I researched the compact digital camera options for some time. I had always used Canon cameras and was happy with them, but I thought I'd try a Nikon because of its strong reputation. I was intrigued at the possibility of shooting HD videos of the kids when I don't have a video camera handy. I got the camera with a leather case in the "kit" package. I put the camera in its case and went to a big box store to get the appropriate SDHC card for the camera. When I got home and went to get the camera out, the back of the camera just above the screen was cracked! I was livid! I am not a person who throws brand new electronics around and I couldn't believe how UN-durable this camera was proving to be. (My Canon A610 has served me well with many bumps and falls in 5 years and it's still working beautifully - but is bigger and heavier to carry around - thus its replacement.) I brought the camera back to the store where I bought it and the clerks told me they couldn't return it because of impact damage. I told them the camera had been in my purse to the store and back. That's it. They said maybe the camera was jostled or perhaps my cell phone bumped the camera. I didn't realize a camera couldn't tolerate a "jostle." They told me to put some electrical tape over the cracked case and move on.I thought I was buying a high-quality camera at $200. At least for that price I wanted it to last more than a few days without significant damage. If you get this camera, do yourself a favor and get a rigid camera case for it - unless you want it easily damaged. If you have a few extra bucks to get yourself a camera with a metal case rather than plastic, opt for the Nikon S8000. Or perhaps an impact-resistant camera. I wish I knew this before buying. I just thought they would naturally be metal or metal underneath with a plastic overlay. Not the case.

Reviews.Title: A Gem of a camera
Reviews.Author: Sandra Dee "quick snapper"
Reviews.Content: The S6000 is the best Nikon I have owned. It is very compact and for close to an amateur the ease of use is as remarkable as the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not a fan
Reviews.Author: Tracieann
Reviews.Content: Just returned this camera after giving it 6 weeks in a variety of situations and setting.  If you shoot still life, this is probably a good camera.  I teach preschool and need a quick shutter speed and a camera that's ready to reshoot in an instant.  This one isn't it.  The pictures seem soft, outdoors was ok but the camera is not ready quickly for a second shot.  And kids move quickly.  Slow to turn on - I often had to tell the children to wait a sec before being able to take the picture.  Indoor shots were yellowish, over-exposed or had facial shadows, and believe me, I tried various flash settings, changed the ISO and the shooting mode.I was very disappointed as the reviews were all great.  Camera has a lot of nice features, but just didn't produce the kind of pictures I was used to with my Canon or Kodak.  Returned it and went back to Kodak.  Don't recommend Nikon s6000.  Am curious to hear how my daughter likes her s3000.

Reviews.Title: Great Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Becky "Becky"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am very happy with my camera.  I wish the small camera's had a view finder for sunny days.  I have not found a good quality small camera with a view finder, so can't knock this camera for not having one.  I did not take the time to read the instructions because, we had a birthday party the day I received the camera.  I took it out, charged, it and headed for the party.  The pics turned out Wonderful.  The zoom is easy to use. My hands tend to shake a lot, and this camera corrected the problem.  No more fuzzy pics.  This is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: davea
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm very satisfied with the camera, the picture quality is excellent the speed is great.  The video is superb and you can zoom in and out while recording, not sure why so many other reviews stated this is not possible, perhaps on the older models you couldn't.  The only con I found is its difficult to use the menu in the dark since the button don't light up, (minor issue) and the location of the video button is cumbersome, once you are finished shooting your video its not super easy to stop with out having several seconds of you fumbling for the button at the end of your video.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: KingMDM
Reviews.Content: This camera just works!  The last digital camera I purchased was approx 10 years ago and it lasted for about 6 years.  I have been without a camera for 3-4 years.  This camera is definitely a huge step up from 10 years ago.  It is easy to point and shoot with the auto settings.  Pictures and videos come out crisp and colorful.  I can tell the picture and video quality is HD and I get a kick out of shooting small videos with sound with this camera.  The compact size is a plus for me as well.  I highly recommend this mid-grade Coolpix. I also purchased a 8GB memory card which seems to hold more pictures/videos than I would ever need since I constantly dump pictures from the camera into my well organized digital album located in my backup storage.  I also purchased an extra USB cable so battery life is not a serious problem since I only take pictures casually.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S6000
Reviews.Author: Debashis
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S6000 is an absolutely fascinating and a too good camera. A brilliant combination of price and quality of 14.2MP and 7X Optical Zoom, the clarity of the photos is too good. It is sturdy too. It once fell out of my hand and hit the iron rods. When I pressed the power button expecting it not to work, lo!! it opened up just fine.Lovely camera and a must buy!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price....
Reviews.Author: Douglas Adam Ibrahim
Reviews.Content: This camera does what it said, If you follow the manual you will not disappointed. One thing that lack is how the battery charge, I preferred charging it from the charger not from the inside the camera. Overall it's pretty good. I don't have any noise when i recorded a video clip, i don't know why people said it make clicking noise!  We purchased this camera from Amazon and got 2 days free shipping, yes we ordered monday and got it on wednesday. Thank you Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: DonnaO
Reviews.Content: Easy to use takes great photos and all the setting are fun to experiment with. Just one annoyance the lense extends even when you just want to view the stored photos.

Reviews.Title: What a deal!
Reviews.Author: Bammer1
Reviews.Content: I was in need of a digital camera for an upcoming trip to New York.  I knew I wanted a point and shoot camera that was small and easy to carry.  After doing some research and reading many reviews I decided on the Nikon Coolpix S6000.  I took the camera for a test run on a short weekend trip.  It took amazingly clear and beautiful pictures.  My friends who were with me even commented on how impressed they were with the pictures.  A quick glance through the manual and your ready to point and shoot.  The battery had a long life ( you still will want to purchase an extra battery with a charger )and it has many shooting options.  Only has 7X optical zoom but that is plenty for me.  Needless to say, I am very happy with this product and would recommed it.

Reviews.Title: Focus and Noise
Reviews.Author: China Goose
Reviews.Content: Camera does not focus on what you want it to neither in autofocus or by selecting centerfocus.Noise reduction turns on even when it's not supposed to causing a really grainy and unacceptable image.Camera lost it's mind when it lost the ability to use flash! I had to call tech support to restore the flash function. The tech guy said that yeah, that happens and so then you have to go to reset to the camera's default settings and lose all your programmed selections.I am disappointed with this camera and ultimately returned it since it just did not work right. I really liked how tiny it was and thus convenient to take anywhere while still being comfortable to hold and to easily use the buttons. Also, the functions were easy to figure out and pretty intuitive if you've ever used a camera before. And the LCD was fairly easy to see even outdoors in bright light.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: B. D. Ogues "DonLee"
Reviews.Content: I regret selling my canon g10 since I bought a nikon DSLR, now I just realized that I need a small camera for small occasions, So I did some researched reviews, I did looked and bought some canon, fuji, sony and nikon, first I thought the s3000 and s4000 would be awesome but no same as sony cybershots, I bought and returned some of them till I saw this s6000 from 2 stores for sale and before I bought it, I did check every reviews from different stores, online and local and it has the best reviews among those I bought first, so I gambled again to try this one and boom! no regrets! I love the picture quality, easy to use, and video capture w/ 720p HD. This camera can go a long way, great for beginners and awesome for travel use. Some people complaints how plastic it is or how light it is but this plastic made can do better than most of those metal made i just returned for refunds and replacements. I think it's just about how we take care of our camera and knows how to use it well. I suggest to read the manual book before using it so you won't be making reviews like this camera doesn't do anything etc etc. in fact this is the best budget under $200 point & shoot so far for me. I had couple olympus stylus and those I just bought and returned but all their quality doesn't have match for this nikon s6000.For memory cards, I'd recommend Sandisk Ultra, Or Lexar Platinum II Which I've been using for my DSLR and Just bought another one for my new CoolPix!P.S Before buying a camera and you're in a budget, Try to do research first, read reviews, and comments to see which camera is best for you. Don't ever buy a camera if you don't know anything about it. especially when you're looking for a great quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: Logan S
Reviews.Content: I love this camera...Great solution when you don't want an SLR due to size.Camera fits in your pocket or purse and light weight.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6000
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to replace the Kodak that we've had for about 4 years.  The Kodak was bulky and the picture quality wasn't the greatest.  This Nikon takes beautiful pictures.  My wife has used it quite a bit in the past month or so, and all the pictures she's taken look great.I noticed that many people who reviewed this camera said that the delay between photos is slow.  We haven't had that problem.  I took about 4 pictures right in a row without a delay at all.  After that 4, it needed a few seconds to catch up, but that's it.The videos are also great.  I have HD resolution on both of my laptops, and with the videos that the camera takes, the clarity is great.  I noticed that if the area isn't well lit when taking a video, it is slightly grainy, but in a bright room or outside, the videos come out looking very nice.I can't wait to take this camera to the zoo this year!My wife loves the camera, and so do I.  I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a nice affordable camera for recreational photography.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Tresa Hanks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been looking at cameras for a while.  We finally ended up purchasing this camera after researching many different cameras.  I am so pleased with our camera.  The picture quality is excellent and it is simple to use.  Some reviews said that the sutter speed was too slow, however I had the opposite experience with it.  I have been taking picture of my 2, 4 and 6 year old very wiggily children and have not had a problem with blurry pictures at all.  I would definiately recommend this camera.  For the price I find it to be a great buy, with great features.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: C. Ozell
Reviews.Content: Haven't had it long & haven't printed up anything.  So far I am loving it.  Really impressed with the range.  I can get really crisp closeups.  Would still love a view finder but am resigned to get used to not having one.  Can't believe I can get such great clarity in really close ups and then long distance in this tiny camera.  So far I am thrilled with it!

Reviews.Title: Loving it so far...
Reviews.Author: Nstang
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost two weeks and have been very happy with it so far. The pictures I have taken came out very sharp and colorful. The speed of the camera is also really nice previously coming from a Nikon S550. I've been pretty happy with the video quality so far. It does lose some if its quality when you zoom in on objects, but I guess that is sort of expected. The stereo sound quality is also very good. It handles deep bass and loud cars fairly well. (I have some examples on YouTube if anyone is interested; search for Nikon S6000 Sound Quality) At first I was not able to edit any of the video I took with Windows Movie Maker or Windows Live Movie Maker, but downloading Format Factory (free download, google it) fixed that problem and I haven't had any issues importing media into the programs. Overall I'm very happy and can't wait to get out and take some more pictures!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Omalyn
Reviews.Content: I went on the hunt for a new "point and shoot camera". The one I was carrying used a memory card that is about to be discontinued. I have a DSLR but it is not always practical to carry.  While searching web sites I read all of the reviews and decided to buy this one. The complaints were mostly about battery life. I tend to ignore bad reviews that do not involve the product but other things like delivery.I liked the look and size of this camera and found it had come down in price, which usually means they are about to introduce another model. I was about to take a trip with my daughter and never expected to get it in time.  It came the day before we left. I didn't have time to read the manual but put it together while I looked over the quick start booklet. I took a picture of my son, in the house with plenty of light etc. I just knew the photo would be over exposed or maybe too much red in the face. I was amazed at the flesh tone. Not only was it natural, it was exactly as he looked. I read later that it has a feature to correct skin tone and it works great.We went to a personal appearance of a celebrity and had to sit in the nose bleed section, tickets were sold out in 2 hours. My daughter took her camera also. The section was dark with the usual spotlight on the stage. I changed the "scene" setting to indoor/party and was prepared to change several times until I got the right effect. After about the third shot, my daughter put her camera away. Her photos couldn't compare with mine for color and clarity. It was a Nikon also, but 2 or 3 years old. I posted some of my photos on Facebook and some of my friends asked if we were really that close to the stage. The zoom and focus couldn't have worked better.When we left the event the next day we had to drive home through the snow. I took many pictures on this trip and the battery never went dead. I plan to buy a spare like my son did but so far I've not had any problems. A lot of people either don't know how or just don't use the "scene" feature.  They are really missing out on some great pictures. I tell my friends it is like using the f-Stop on the SLR at a much cheaper price.The battery thing is something I really expected. When these cameras first came out it was apparent that using the screen to view your photos was a battery drain along with the zooming and flash. Now that they no longer have view finders, we will just have to live with it. If it is a real concern, invest in a spare battery but you can't beat the camera for photo quality.Linda

Reviews.Title: Great pictures on the go
Reviews.Author: Carmen Ferreiro-Esteban
Reviews.Content: I have had a LCD Nikon camera for many years and used it only occasionally.I bought the Nikon 6000 to be able to carry it with me all the time. I didn't expect it to compare to my other camera. But I was surprised. The pictures I take with it are amazing in detail and quality. Plus I can aim it for angles I couldn't try when I had to look through the eye finder.After years of procrastination I am back to taking pictures.I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It's what you make it
Reviews.Author: T. Jobczynski
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It can be totaly automatic or manual on the setting. Clear pictures with no noise. I am having trouble with the macro setting. I like taking close up nature pictures. I'll have to keep playing to get it right.Overall , great camera, great quality.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Anastasia Green
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  I find that the picture quality is excellent and the camera is easy to use.  It is compact enough to bring with me but not so small that it is difficult to use.  I have even found that I can take photos of my pets in certain light with the flash and still avoid pet eye.  I like the feature of editing the photos right on the camera and that the new photo is saved as well as the original.  I recommend this camera highly.

Reviews.Title: NIKON IS THE BEST!
Reviews.Author: GSXR-Ryan
Reviews.Content: This camera is simple to use, fast to turn on, and is always in focus.  The only downside to this camera is you almost need a secondary battery so it can be charging while you are using the camera.  Every picture I take with this camera is in focus, it doesn't matter if it is of dogs or kids running and playing or any lighting or landscape.  The colors show up life like and the pictures have a depth quality when they are developed.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Happyfeet
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera a bit and just loved using it.  I own a SLR digital camera but I did not want to travel with such a large camera.  This camera was easy to carry, to use and took good pictures

Reviews.Title: Nikon S6000
Reviews.Author: Barbara LaRue
Reviews.Content: This is a great little feature loaded camera. It takes good quality pictures and videos.  I have several larger cameras but they are cumbersome to carry around or travel with.  This is a perfect size for the pocket, purse, or carry on luggage.  I'm very, very pleased with the performance of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: CatCat
Reviews.Content: So far, the camera has delivered as it said it would. I've taken mostly indoor photos and it does great with indoor/natural lighting...the pictures were nice and sharp and the colors were stunning.  And it actually captures the facial details of my black cat which is not an easy thing to do.  I'm still playing with the different scene options but the panoramic assist is great!My only gripe is that they forgot to include the USB cable so I couldn't transfer the pictures off the camera. After taking quite a few photos and then realizing that you have no way of getting the pictures out of the camera was extremely frustrating.  Fortunately for me, I was able to borrow one from a friend who owns a different Coolpix camera and that USB cable just happened to work with this camera.I would definitely recommend this camera -- just check the box for the USB cable.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: All Around Raleigh Dj
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  I really wanted a camera that I could charge while downloading the pictures and this one does that.  I've gotten some blurry pictues with moving things - like my dog but thats the only thing I don't like 100%. Its pretty fast and I thought it was the best deal out there.

Reviews.Title: Just purchased new Nikon Coolpix Camera
Reviews.Author: Gal from Paris, TX
Reviews.Content: I recently replaced my old digital with the CoolPix camera.  I love it!  The zoom feature on this camera is so much better than on my old one.  The pictures are so sharp and clear.  The larger viewing screen makes it easy to see, even without my glasses!

Reviews.Title: excellent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: W. Allison "Eager Reader"
Reviews.Content: This slim compact camera fits well in a pocket.  The electronics are very fast and responsive, one of its strongest features.  The size is small and not the easiest to handle, but that is what you expect with a little pocket camera. The buttons are okay, but rather tiny.  Multiple program modes are available and the multi-point  auto-focusing is good.  The menus are average, but common features are available using the circular control on the back.  The display panel has excellent anti-reflective coatings and works well in daylight.  The display illumination can be changed, but is buried deep in the menus.  It has no viewfinder, which I don't like.  Holding the camera against your face is important for zoom shots, low light, or closeups.  The lens zoom range is very good, but not the largest.  The lens quality is excellent.  Very good anti-reflective coatings.  The optical distortion is very small and people will never notice it.  The video recordings are very good and include several resolutions up to HD quality.  The audio quality is above average for a pocket camera.  The battery is a special rechargeable lithium, one is included.  It gives good service, but a backup battery is essential to have on hand.  The battery is normally charged in the camera, but an external charger is can be purchased.  Overall this is a very good quality pocket camera with the limitations you would expect in its class.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Betker "Apple fanatic"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take with me to Iraq while deployed.  I wanted something that would fit in my pocket, have good zoom capability but was fairly inexpensive.  This has been a terrific little camera.  I let my 11-year old son use it before I left and he took some terrific photos with it.  I'm really surprised at the One- and  Two- star reviews stating they had fuzzy pictures, etc.  He and I have had no problems.  It does have a slight lag in the auto-focus, which is pretty much an issue with all point and shoot digital cameras, that's why I rated it as a 4-star.  But what do you expect for a little over $100.  If you are shooting scenes with lots of motion, sports or kids moving, etc., a point and shoot is the wrong camera anyway, you'll need to move up to DSLR to be happy.  When I return, I'll pass this camera on to my son and I'll be confident knowing that he has a good, relatively inexpensive camera to help capture his memories.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera!
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: That's exactly what it is.....this Nikon S6000 is a great point and shoot. I already own Nikon's High end film cameras, DSLRs and lens. I needed a compact point and shoot for when I travel light. The controls are so user friendly and the menu just like its big brother DSLR's is very easy to navigate.I needed a point and shoot with a 28mm or wider lens and the lens is a Nikon ED all glass lens! The pictures are excellent in color and contrast. Flash or no flash the pictures are on the money. Nikon's metering system has always been their high point giving true to life color rendering in all their cameras....it's not always the amount of megapixels alone that make a great camera.Focus is not an issue....many times the out of focus is not the camera but the person using it and this is true with any camera including DSLR's...you have to get use to using the camera. Continuous shooting mode and best shot selection feature is a big plus with this camera.  Nice well built,compact and very cool looking camera....it's perfect for any level photographer.

Reviews.Title: The camera matches all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Jak
Reviews.Content: I did a great deal of research before purchasing the Nikon Coolpix. I needed macro capability, a large viewing screen, vibration reduction and fast zooming for composition. So far the Nikon Coolpix S6000has met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: nikon camera review
Reviews.Author: Lorraine M Boardwine
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the price. Not as easy to figure out what settings to use for which picture taking situation.Pictures are clear and nice color.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Collin Wayne "Steven"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for the price.  I got this as a gift and I would have to say this is a good point and shoot camera.  No, this isn't for the professional photographer but for portability it is fantastic.  Always happy with Nikon products.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - great price!
Reviews.Author: Lisa L. Wilkosz
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the camera.  Also, the delivery was quick and the camera came with a case and extended warranty that I wasn't expecting.

Reviews.Title: Fast start up and shutter speed, great size, durability and consistent photo quality may be an issue
Reviews.Author: Andrea Polk
Reviews.Content: After dropping my Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver) I was looking for a point n' shoot camera that was small enough to put in my pocket or purse, but still full-featured and with a price less than $150.  I found it in the Coolpix S6000.Reviews for this camera on Cnet and YouTube convinced me it would be a good buy, but I wasn't expecting to be instantly 'wowed' by it!  Being an intermediate digital photo enthusiast I've played with a lot of different digital cameras of varying sizes, speeds and with assorted perks such as optical zoom, macro and video capabilities.  While each one seemed to have one or two things it did very well, the Canon I dropped was as close to an all-purpose, go-to camera.  Upon playing with this Nikon I find myself wondering how I ever considered the Canon anywhere close to what I should want in a camera of this type.The Nikon Coolpix S6000 is my new favorite camera for everyday use because...1. Size - so compact and lightweight, you can carry it anywhere.2. HD Video - with the addition of a SDHC memory card (recommend 16 to 32GB) you have an HD video camera with stereo sound.3. Nikon lens takes great photos!4. Easy to set-up and use, out of the box.5. Many, many scene options for just the right settings, whatever your photo taking circumstances.  Really, really like the 'backlighting' one!6. Not a huge learning curve, so anyone from a child to a grandparent can easily learn to use it and take great photos.7. With 14.2 MP you can take great photos and get them enlarged to poster size without a loss of clarity or sharpness.8. It's as automatic as digital cameras get, but still takes amazing photos.9. Battery charges quickly via AC outlet hook-up, and holds a charge for hundreds of photos.10. 7x optical zoom is more than enough for most distance photos, and if you prefer to zoom in on something small like an insect or the petals of a rose, you have macro too.11. Face and smile recognition means you don't miss the perfect shot.12. Super-fast photo taking with image stablization - again, no missed or fuzzy shots.13. True color reproduction.14. Video or photo viewing via HDMI port on camera.15. Everything most families, students, travelers, and/or casual camera users could want in one inexpensive, easy-to-use package.If it seems like I'm gushing over this one, I am!  It's not often that I'm this happy with the speed, quality and ease of use of a camera, but this one does it for me.  The HD video is just the icing on the cake.If you are looking for a great 'go-to', point and shoot camera, this is the one!UPDATE: July 4, 2011After having used this camera in many different settings for months now I still consider this my point-n'-shoot, go to camera, but I wonder how long it will last?This evening it simply stopped - screen went black while viewing photos on the SD card - and the lens was out.  Turning it on and off did nothing, so I plugged in the charger - it too did nothing.  I removed the battery to check it and when I reseated it, the lens retracted.  I am charging it now and when untethered to the charger, it does turn on and off.I took some HD video the other day - it came out great, but I wonder if so sucked the battery that this happened?  I didn't see a low battery signal, so I find this curious.I'm finding I get hit and miss results on 'auto', but have learned to play with the scene settings to usually find something that works with a few trial and error shots.  The zoom works fairly well, but it's not meant for most distance shots over say 20'.Crossing my fingers this stoppage isn't a precursor to death.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera !
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I have been a serious amature photographer for 40 years and have to say that this point and shoot camera is doing every thing that I am asking of it.As always good Nikon glass.The menu is easy to use.No problem with battery cover coming open.300 photos in the 2 months that I have owned this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: nelle
Reviews.Content: I am no technie but after a little practice at home, I was able to photograph a horse racing competition.  I took it off Auto focus, used Tracking and got some wonderful action shots.  The small size was one of the reasons for buying this camera and it fits nicely in my jacket pocket.

Reviews.Title: Shame on you Nikon.
Reviews.Author: Richard O. Mead
Reviews.Content: Yes, the pictures are pretty good but for goodness sakes the Nikon View and Nikon Transfer software is terrible. And, Nikon, how could you design worse access port covers for the battery, memory chip and transfer cable! I use a Nikon D200 for professional photography and got the S6000 as an emergency back up camera.

Reviews.Title: There's a reason it's called "Coolpix"
Reviews.Author: T. Morrow
Reviews.Content: First of all I didn't buy the camera on amazon I bought it at a retail outlet but here goes anyway.In my opinion. The only problem with the Nikon s6000 is the overall picture color.No matter what settings you use the pictures are heavily blue shifted.You can't see it on the camera's view screen because it is rather shifted to warm colors making the pictures look completely normal. It's when you look at the pics on a computer, HDTV or prints the blueish hues come out. like I said there's a reason it's called Coolpix The pictures have a cool hue to them. But other than that it's an overall OK camera. Of course I take mostly outdoor pictures. The impression I got from Nikon"s commercials it seems like it's mostly for takings pictures at parties or indoors in general

Reviews.Title: Photo OK, Video so so
Reviews.Author: J. Tranie "Jerome T"
Reviews.Content: Thi camera is nice, light and handy. The screen is good. Easy to find the commands and menus are simple.It would have been better with a separate charger for the battery. But battery life is ok.The photo quality is ok. Sharp pictures and colorful. The camera is snappy but between photos with flash, it can take up to 10-15 sec between each shot...And zooming could be slow some times.The video quality is not so great even if this Nikon S6000 shoots in HD resolution you can see the video image is not sharp. Low light condition the video is kind dark. Quality is not as good.But considering the price of this camera overall this is ok.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed
Reviews.Author: TQ "TQ"
Reviews.Content: I've had a Canon SD400 since back when 3MP was the hot thing to have. Cost me $350.It has been a great camera but figured it was time for an upgrade since we are in the 14MP range now.I did a lot of research on a new camera before buying and figured I'd try the Nikon S6000 because Ashton Kutcher made it look like it worked well.Pros:- The obvious specs- individual buttons for each mode- Good daytime picsCons:- Pics in darker places all have motion blur like everyone is moving very fast and the light is trailing behind them. No matter what "scene" I tried.. no good- No external charging block for the battery- Uses "mini-USB" instead of the more populare "micro-USB"- Menus look like something made by fisher-price- Very slow shutter. Have to wait 5 secs for next pic- No "quick preview" of last picture after taking.- "Scenes" don't appear to make sense.. Party mode assumes you are in daylight apparently because it forces the flash disabled. So much for night partiesThe main issue is the low-light quality and blur. I get better pics in the same setting from my 8mp phone camera. I am likely going to sell it on ebay and go back to canon. My 3MP camera still takes better shots and I'm sure the newer models should have improvements on other bits too.

Reviews.Title: Super easy takes great pics
Reviews.Author: handsomeman 57
Reviews.Content: I replaced  a 5 year old SONY Cybershot that I dropped.  i really liked it and it took great pics. I also have a very nice NIKON D50 DSLR that takes amazing pics but a little too involved for quick and dirty shots.  At first I thought the colors were a little blue washed - then I  played with the little icons (Landscape, portrait, sunset etc...  in the menu) a bit and now the colors look marvelous.  i do not play with the the  settings too much as you don't have to, and have not even tried a movie yet. I snap a lot of shots and now they all seem to be coming out perfect.The interface  and charge ability via the USB to the computer is very clean and works well and fast.  THe camera also takes shots pretty quickly compared to other point and clicks i have used tried.  Not sure why this got so cheap- I paid  119 or so and its just a remarkable little gadget, sort of glad i dropped and broke my other one as these things have advanced SO much in the past 4-5 years.  Since I got it I have not even taken out my NIKON DSLR.  (except to swipe memory)..Also as an FYI I  switched from Shutterfly to Picassa (3) what a huge improvement if you post a lot of pics.

Reviews.Title: Wow.
Reviews.Author: Nichiolas Smith "CruiseDivo"
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best camera I owned. I have owned 7 different ones: Kodak, Canon, Olympus, and now Nikon. The colors are vivid. 14.2 Megapixels with 7x optical zoom with image stabilizer, come on now. How can you beat this!!!!!. The images in Low light are the best I have seen. Very rich colors. A must buy. Can't wait to use this on my cruise this year.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the extra $ for the HD capability
Reviews.Author: C. Mcmahan
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed to find that the movie file format is only available as .mov instead of .avi.  Maybe this is because it's HD?  I don't know, but I compared it head to head with 2 other cameras and the video quality was far below a new Nikon 570 and a 2 year old Canon power shot A720.  What's the point of paying extra for HD movie quality if the file compression makes it grainy?!  Also, to make quick copies of the movies to send to grandparents, I just use the software that came with Windows Vista- well, that software doesn't recognize .mov files.  You have to use quick time to play them back and I'm not sure what I'd need to use to burn them to a DVD. I am not interested in finding yet another software product.The quality of head to head point and shoot snapshots was also not any better on this model than on the S570.  The only reason I would see to keep this over either the S640 or S570 would be if you really needed the 7x zoom over the 5x zoom.  I was more concerned at the lack of video quality than I was over going from 7x to 5x so I took it back.Pros- good zoom, really easy to use buttons and menus, tiny, quick recovery time between shotscons- .mov format for movies, a lot of 'auto focus' background noise recored in the videos I took, photo quality not any better than a less expensive model and video quality worse.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but not incredible
Reviews.Author: teton jared
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a week ago. So far it is decent, but not incredible. The major con with me is the purple fringing that appears when a little over exposed. It mostly happens on out door photos along the skyline. I am finding that I can some times fix it with the exposure dial, but not always. I take a lot of photos outside, so this is an issue with me. Other than that it does take some really nice pics. The flash is a little weak. The HD video has the same problem with the purple fringing as well. I use the video a lot and maybe would have bought a different camera if i knew this. Once again, when the fringing is not there it takes good video. You can zoom the video, but not a lot. Lots of nice scene options and pretty easy to use. The zoom is great on this camera. I took some photos of some mountains and really zoomed in on them and it produced a very crisp photo still.I think this camera is great for carrying around for every day random photos, fits in pocket or pack very nicely and has a quick start up as advertised. I am very active and take most of my photos while mountaineering and snowboarding, and so far not super impressed. I only have been using it for a week so I will maybe do a follow up later.

Reviews.Title: A great upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Kyre
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my sister for Christmas.  We both have other models of Coolpix cameras but she was looking for more zoom.  These cameras are easy to operate and offer a wide range of options. This gift was the perfect one.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: tkt
Reviews.Content: i was up in arms when my ancient point and shoot died. it meant a search for a new one that was just as great as my old one, not too complicated and within a decent budget. my old camera was a cannon and i really loved its straight forward simplicity. after not being able to find a cannon that impressed me and had consistently good reviews along with fitting into my budget, i decided to check out the highly advertised coolpix range by nikon. my slr is a nikon and i've always been really happy with it, so i wasn't afraid of the brand change. this camera is really nice. it takes good pictures, has a lot to play around with and a decent design. i haven't completely explored all of the features yet, but my only slight frustration i have with it is that it seems like the flash takes a minute to allow for a picture to be taken right after another sometimes. again, i haven't spent too much time trying to figure out all the ins and outs. as a whole, i'm quite satisfied with my purchase, and i really like how long the battery lasts on it as well.

Reviews.Title: great pics, quick response
Reviews.Author: Hope Hankin
Reviews.Content: I love the speed of picture taking with this camera and so far I've gotten no blurs, no dark pictures, and the color is great with the automatic setting.  There are a lot of options that you can set manually and setting them can be tedious and take awhile, but so far the color options (black & white, sepia, standard color, vivid color) and the setting options (I use the close-up macro and ISO the most but there are lots - beach scenes, fireworks, etc.) have been great once I get them set.I started with a really nice Sony compact camera but when I pressed the button it took two full seconds for the picture to take - way too long with moving children.  I have a nice Sony DSLR with better response time and my intention with a compact camera was something that takes quick, clear pix and fits in my purse so I always have it.  This Nikon responds as soon as I press the shutter button - probably less than a quarter second response time.I learned the hard way though - if you edit a photo on the camera and it says "please wait while camera finishes recording" DO NOT remove the battery to turn it off no matter how long it freezes up!  It was my first day with the camera and I did not know what it was doing, and it froze for so long that perhaps I had no choice, AND there were other pictures on the SD card I had used in a digital frame so perhaps that was my error.  I had to open the camera and pull out the battery to turn it off, and it corrupted every photo on the card, including the new ones I had just taken.  A quick reformat of the card (in the camera) and it is now working fine.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: common man
Reviews.Content: First of all great delivery from Amazon.Great camera and I am very much satisfied with quality of this camera. Options are bit cumbersome to look for otherwise camera is great.

Reviews.Title: Camera Shuts Off Constantly
Reviews.Author: disappointed_customer
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera!  I have only had my camera a few months and have not used it much because it constantly shuts off within seconds of me turnng it on.  This has been so frustating!  At first I could get a few shots in before it shut off, now it shuts off immediately after I turn it on so I can't take any pictures at all.  I feel so ripped off by this purchase.  This was a new camera, and not a cheap one, and its a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Perfect choise
Reviews.Author: MURAT VZMEN
Reviews.Content: I think its a perfect choice for non-professional takers, it is the best product for taking photo easily and with quality.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: scutpuppy
Reviews.Content: This camera is full of features and takes very good pictures and videos. The body is not made of metal like the first Coolpix but it is more affordable with newer technologies so I cannot complain. Nikon has to trim the cost somehow to keep the price reasonable. It is a great camera for the non professional photographers.

Reviews.Title: First and last Nikon
Reviews.Author: wascoman
Reviews.Content: Like many of the other reviewers I was never very impressed with the photos that this camera took.  My old Canon digital did much better.  But, I liked some of the features on this camera until it stopped focusing after about one year of use.  Every picture is now out of focus.This was my first Nikon camera and it will also be my last.  I got away from Canon because I was frustrated with their shutter lag.  Maybe I'll try Panasonic?

Reviews.Title: Great camera if you're looking for a throw-away
Reviews.Author: Susan Cross
Reviews.Content: The camera took great pictures until the Ion battery stopped taking a charge in less than one year. I asked how long it should continue to take a charge and was told, depends on how long the battery was sitting on the shelf. Not acceptable answer. Bought a new battery for $45. That seemed to work until now when the shutter doesn't open fully and I get a black mark in the lower left hand side of every shot. I was loyal to Nikon for the last 2 cameras but not anymore. A camera should last more than 2 years, shouldn't it? Pictures were great but shutter speed was slow. I just bought another brand. Hopefully this will serve me better.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Jason in Hollywood
Reviews.Content: I loved this Coolpix camera - it takes great photos and has a great zoom for such a small camera which fits into your pocket.However, the only problem I have with Nikon cameras, and maybe this is actually a digital camera issue, is that they keep getting specs under the lens. Not scratches on the lens itself, but dust/matter inside on the sensor so that dots appear on every picture. It's my second Nikon camera that this has happened to. The first I sent away to repair (which took around 8 weeks, which is not great when you use every day), on this camera it happened after the 1 year warranty expired, so I bought a new camera instead.

Reviews.Title: Product with issues, poor quality.
Reviews.Author: SVMOJITO
Reviews.Content: I bought this and another Nikon camera as gifts.  This one has gone back to Nikon for warranty repair three months after we got it, as the lense cover would refuse to open.  The quality of this camera is poor and the customer service is poor.  The other Nikon Coolpix 1100S PJ camera has been at Nikon for over four months and they are now asking that we pay $84 to replace parts that failed shortly after using it.  I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER NIKON POINT AND SHOOT.  Amazon's Customer Service is the Best & NIKON's customer service is the worst!!!!

Reviews.Title: You'll miss ALL your shots with this camera
Reviews.Author: ponygirl
Reviews.Content: What a terrible purchase. None of the features really matter if you miss shot after shot after shot, because the camera takes so, so, so long to auto adjust, and then click. By then, the kids that were engaged in a razzle, are now walking away, the dogs that were having a staredown, are now taking a dump, and so on. I absolutely cannot recommend this camera at all, unless you like to take pictures of a vase, or other inanimate objects, that never move. For you it would be just fine.

Reviews.Title: nice pictures - frustrating disfunction
Reviews.Author: Joyce
Reviews.Content: When I first got this camera I REALLY loved it. It had nice picture and video quality but about 4 months after I got it the lens started malfunctioning. First it just started leaving part of the lens covered - sort of a thumb over the edge of the lens affair and then it just quit opening altogether. Not a happy camper. I am looking for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Peterson "AJ"
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this camera, I resisted the temptation to get the newer touch-screen version of this camera.  And despite the $20 cheaper price on the newer version, I think I did the right thing.  This is a very small camera and you really can't help putting your fingers on the screen while using it.  So I really think the mechanical controled S6000 version is definitely the way to go.Beyond that I was VERY impressed with this camera.  The pictures are VERY clear and the features totally blow me away.  I've had hundreds of cameras in my lifetime.  Many of them very high-end and some cheaper ones.  But this one is my favorite.  Its almost like Nikon took all my favorite features of my previously owned cameras and crammed all their best features into the S6000.  If you are a point-and-shoot photographer, this camera is fantastic, but if you like to push the enevelope with a camera (like I do), this camera will go right along with the program.  The camera is nice and small and can be slipped into your shirt pocket very easily so I always have it with me.  Battery life seems to be fantastic too.  I purchased my first Nikon in Hong-Kong back in 1968.  This is only my second Nikon and I'm wondering why I ever used anything else!

Reviews.Title: nice pictures, bad shutter
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a few months ago.  I love the picture quality and it is pretty easy to use if you have used nikon cameras before.  However the shutter/lens jams often and does not close completely. I often prefer my old nikon coolpix s6 it is a much better camera in general

Reviews.Title: Good camera but BEWARE - lens is extremely fragile
Reviews.Author: ekestes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the purpose of having a good point-and-shoot for active adventures outdoors (climbing, hiking, backpacking, backcountry skiing).  I have had it for about a year now, and it has been on many adventures.  It takes great pictures, and I have captured many great moments with it.  I felt compelled to write this review because the lens will no longer open and the camera has been rendered useless.  To be fair, the camera has been used in more rugged environments that what many people would encounter (rock climbing in particular).  But if you are someone who is active and plans to take this camera into similar environments, be warned.  The mechanical lens components are very fragile and even the slightest hit can prevent them from functioning properly.  I was about as cautious as you can be with a camera in such environments, and still within 1 year it is unusable and I am forced to go camera shopping once again.  I have discussed this issue with others who have owned similar CoolPix models and it seems to be a common thread.  If durability is a main concern for you, look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: Great little carry-along camera
Reviews.Author: ARO
Reviews.Content: I am both a part-time photographer and a designer of interior window fashions.  For heavy-duty photo shoots for production or for art I use my Nikon D 300S and get all the great control that you get with the big equipment scene and I love the results.  However, for quick before and after shots or for documenting product issues in my window fashions business I have found the little coolpix cameras to be indispensable.In fact, I just purchased my 4th little coolpix.  This one.  My first coolpix was the P4, purchased back in 2004 or 2005.  I carried it in my briefcase to all prospective customer sites and recorded everything from beginning to end with it.  The 'scenes' were a crucial factor in successfully shooting window dressings, as I could go from the museum setting to the backlit setting to really capture the room.  Awkward details that present challenges?  Instantly converted to close up and got great clear shots of uneven trim, out-of-square corners and obstructions.  It was considerably more rugged than I had any right to expect from a small inexpensive camera.  The design business is full of heavy sample books and ladders that get jumbled together in the back of a van, but the little camera just put up with the abuse.I loved the little camera so much that I purchased the s6000 for my sister and my installer so that they could get the same great detail shots with no training.  It is really incredible the quality of photos we have for every job we do with very poor conditions--low light and frequently high levels of dust.  The photos are almost always great for what they are.  We have great portfolios of every job.  Not magazine ready, but good enough to sell new customers on what we can do for them.Recently I dropped my little P4 for the last time.  I had no hesitation about getting another coolpix.  I tried another one in the series but returned it after only 30 minutes because the features just weren't suitable for what I needed.  I returned the newer model and found this slightly older model.  I have used the ones I gave to others and know it will be perfect for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Little Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Richardson "animal lover"
Reviews.Content: I have been lugging around my big camera on vacations, and never brought it out otherwise as it was a pain to carry around.  All my friends have compact digitals now and the picture quality has improved so vastly, that I finally bit the bullet and purchased this Nikon.  Simple to use, great quality of photos and so wonderful to stick in my purse or pocket.  We just returned from a vacation to Europe, and it was a dream to have a camera so small and lightweight.  My photos were as good as a DSL camera my friend brought with. I am amazed and may never go back to using my bigger camera (except to a trip to see the polar bears this fall as I will definitely need the best zoom lens).  I used to take so much time lining up the shoot, and here it was just point and click with awesome results.  I highly recommend this camera to any novice or professional that needs a quick, small camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Cheri A. Mcdannell
Reviews.Content: This camera takes nice pictures.  It's not as easy to use as my Canon was but due to bad customer service with Canon, I decided on a Nikon.  Pretty easy to use though.  I'm still getting used to it and figuring out how to use the different features.  I had taken a video over the weekend  and that turned out pretty well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent compact camera
Reviews.Author: Gary P. Sklaver
Reviews.Content: While a compact camera will never, in my opinion, produce the same quality picture as a good digital SLR, this camera was perfect for those times when a digital SLR is too cumbersome to take along.  Recently bought this camera for a trip to Costa Rica and it performed great.  Beautiful pictures, many different settings and very light and compact.  I will now pass it along to my wife who finds an SLR too heavy and complicated and just wants a good camera to take photos of grandchildren.

Reviews.Title: Great little HD camera!
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Got is as an anniversary present for my boyfriend, who ended up proposing that weekend! So it was able to capture all the great post-engagment pics of me crying and all the sparkles that the ring has. Captured tiny details which were so important that weekend. He's currently using it to take professional looking photos for action figure reviews and it gives all the detail his readers want. We like it so far. Some of the detailed options are a little difficult, so this is an intermediate camera, I would say, not for beginners.

Reviews.Title: nikon s6000
Reviews.Author: joose
Reviews.Content: great camera! i am totally pleased with quality of pics and the overall use of this camera. it takes the pics fast. and it fits in my pocket.  A+

Reviews.Title: Troublemaker
Reviews.Author: two foots
Reviews.Content: I am more than pleased with this product.  I have been able to use it on a number of occasions with great results.  The quality of the pictures far exceeded my expectations.  I really enjoy the size of the camera it is easy to put it into a pocket or purse.  The buttons on the camera are not too small and the screen makes the taken pictures easy to view.

Reviews.Title: Best of the Point and Shoots
Reviews.Author: Duane Thorp
Reviews.Content: For the short period I have owned this camera I find it to excel my expectations. It has produced art quality panoramas unlike anything I was able to create with my 35mm equipment. This is far more than a "point-and-shoot" camera, its manual functions make picture taking fun again. Tha ability to take black and white photos again is a real kick. Buy this or plan on the next step, which will cost at least $500 more.Update now that I have used this camera for months. A major draw-back is no view finder. I was hoping the screen would be bright enough for daytime pictures, but it is not. It is not "point-and-shoot", but point-shoot-and-hope you get the picture you want. In direct sunlight, you can't see anything on the view screen.

Reviews.Title: gr8 pics....gr8 camera
Reviews.Author: Tash
Reviews.Content: This camera is gr8. has a lot of features and takes really clear, quality photos. my husband loves it as e have a 7 month old daughter and he's taking pics of her everyday...1 downside though is that the panoramic feature doesnt work as i thought u have 2 take 3 separate pics and then it will combine it. i wanted 1 continuous shot.

Reviews.Title: It's ok, but spend a little more for the s8100 which is AWESOME.
Reviews.Author: Amanda Augustinack
Reviews.Content: This model is ok - not terrible, but not good enough for me to keep.  While it was good for outdoor shots, it's definitely not a good flash camera.  If you have a little extra to spend, I would suggest getting the Nikon s8100 - it is AWESOME - easy to use, great zoom, great flash shots, great low light shots.  Totally worth the extra cost (and its the #1 rated Consumer reports point-n-shoot camera).All in all, I would recommend getting either a cheaper camera, or more expensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Broke in 3 Months, Nikon Failed to Repair
Reviews.Author: Melissa F. Olson
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for me on Amazon, and I loved it...for three months. Then it simply stopped charging. I called Nikon, who couldn't figure out if it was the battery, the charger, or the phone itself. I paid to ship it to Nikon myself, and they kept it for a month on a "parts hold." When it finally came back to me, the camera still wouldn't charge or turn on - exactly the same as when I sent it in.I called Nikon again, and they said all I could do was send it back in for more repairs. I asked to just get a new camera, and they said I could put in a "request" for that and they would kick it up the chain of command. Meanwhile, as all this time goes by my two-year-old is hitting new milestones every day, and I have no way to record these memories! The Coolpix, when it worked, was a neat camera, but definitely not worth all this. I would recommend getting a camera from a different company.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy :(
Reviews.Author: Mrs Kindle
Reviews.Content: This camera has great specs, however I am not happy with its picture quality.  Every pic I took had red-eye problems even after reading the entire manual and adjusting all of the settings I could not get a desirable result.  It does alright outside but... inside it produces very dark grainy pics.  I am returning this product and sticking with my old reliable Vanon A540.

Reviews.Title: love my Nikon
Reviews.Author: J. Spears
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera for everyday use and snapshots. I use this for vacation and family events. It's light and easy to carry. Fits in a pocket. Has great ISO sensitivity, vibration reduction, and a clear screen. Takes wonderful snapshots. It's perfect for when you want to capture a moment easily.

Reviews.Author: Brent Roth
Reviews.Content: IT WAS FOR MY WIFE I THINK SHE LIKES IT ALOT. I KNOW SHE USES IT ALOT, THE PICS A RE REALY CLEAR

Reviews.Title: I purchased this USED camera with the understanding it was in better that good shape and worked perfectly .... WRONG !!!  It de
Reviews.Author: Margie Boroz
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying a used camera but it stated it was in good condition and worked great / included all the original accessories. I took a chance buying the more expensive used camera........ WHAT A MISTAKE !!!!!  This camera is HORRIBLE !! The pictures double up .... to review a picture .. the camera says " File contains no image data " ..... yet when I remove my memory card ( SanDick 8GB ) .....  download onto my computer ..... the pictures are there .  I try taking pictures and this camera then doesn't record it on the memory card ! VERY frustrating !! I now CANNOT use this camera to take pictures in fear of not having that picture !  I truly will NEVER trust and buy a used camera again through your company !  I am soooooo very upset about this purchase !

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: I ordered this "used: and its clean and works great, takes lots of great pics. Im still learning everything on it but its a pleasure traveling with it and experimenting in different light and environments. thank you!!

Reviews.Title: Compact, Idiot-proof Point & Shoot and High Quality Images
Reviews.Author: T. DeWitt
Reviews.Content: This is not a camera I'd buy for myself (I'm the DSLR type), but it made a perfect gift for my son and daughter in-law to capture those "special" moments with their new baby. The camera is simplistic in design so that even the digital camera newbie can quickly learn to take good pictures with it. The camera is compact enough to fit into a pocket and lacks any external attachments that might get lost or be in the way. Basically, you pick up the camera, turn it on, select the appropriate scene setting and snap away at your subject. The 7x zoom is generally enough for the quick photo of a landscape or a portrait, and for the times the optical zoom isn't quite enough, the 14 megapixel file size allows a fair amount of digital zooming without degrading the picture quality. After two years of regular use, this camera is still working flawlessly.One recommendation I would make to anyone buying this camera is to buy at least one extra battery (I bought two) and keep it charged and in your camera bag at all times. The one disadvantage of buying a camera that takes a special battery is that you can't just run into a store and buy another one if you discharge the one battery you have and you don't have the time or place to recharge it.

Reviews.Title: Everething Good
Reviews.Author: Pierina
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara! Útil para fines recreativos y turísticos. Buena resolución y excelentes videos.Realmente fue una buena compra. Recomendada! :)

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Juliebar
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to purchase a used camera online, but I absolutely love my new camera! It looks brand new and the picture clarity is amazing! This camera is perfect for travel, as it can fit right in your pocket or your purse. We will be going to Disney in March and I am confident knowing that I will get some great pics with this camera, and I don't have to carry around my big bulky one all day.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gia Gia "Gia"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Got it to replace my original which some dopey kid dropped and broke.Picture quality is very good for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: viewscreen broke easily
Reviews.Author: Diane A. Dunn
Reviews.Content: The viewscreen on this camera, which I owned for less than a year, broke easily. I don't even know how. I took it to the ballpark, took photos and when I came home, the viewscreen was broken. The camera was easy to use the little I used it. Very disappointed in it. I've had Sony cameras before and since and not broken the viewscreen.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy construction, smooth operation
Reviews.Author: Steve Cohen "Sam_Cam"
Reviews.Content: Sturdy construction, smooth operation, lots of features and good quality pictures. I have a canon SLR, but in the car, riding a bike, canoeing, etc, this small package comes in handy for photos I would have missed - in between an SLR and a smart phone camera

Reviews.Title: Stopped working for no reason
Reviews.Author: Paul Livingston
Reviews.Content: I bought the S6000 a year and a half ago and didn't use it that much during the time I had it. One day it just quit working. I'd turn it on and it would turn itself off 10 seconds later. I tried two different batteries (the original and a 3rd party battery), both fully charged, neither worked. During the year and a half it did work, video quality was good, audio was not so good. Picture quality was average for this type of camera. Memory card access door was easy to open, difficult to close. Shutter lag between photos was much too long, in my opinion. I would not buy this camera again, or would I recommend it to anyone. It's a shame too...I'm used to high quality stuff from Nikon. This camera is an exception.

Reviews.Title: WHAT A GREAT LIL CAMERA!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera as an upgrade of my older s4000 camera works well was easy to learn and was shipped to me just in time for an event I wanted it for, so far I haven't noticed to much difference in the s4000 and the s6000 but I haven't played with its features much yet. But this camera is just a lil thicker and I do love the champagne color is its really pretty. I'm very happy with my amazon purchase of this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Bradleyswissman "LatinGeek"
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely amazing. I have dropped it and banged it and it is still absolutely perfect! It creates great pictures! Here is one that I took in Switzerland:[...]this picture has never been touched up... It shows you the power of Nikon! I have had it for around 1 1/2 years. It is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Karolyn L. Koehn
Reviews.Content: I haven't had this camera very long yet but it looks like it is easy to use and I like the color selections - I have been wanting a camera that does black and white pictures -So looks like I will really like this one-

Reviews.Title: Product great, details not
Reviews.Author: gwoman8920
Reviews.Content: I already owned this camera and bought a refurbished one for my mom for mothers day. The camera is not a problem, the details about the camera on Amazon are. I could not find anything about whether or not the refurbished camera came with a Nikon battery, or charger or anything. The way the description reads, you are just getting the camera. I purchased a battery pack with charger and a Nikon battery as well because I didn't want her to not have those.The camera does actually come with aforementioned products. All in all, we both just have an amazing back up system when we travel, and will never not have a battery or charger for either of our cameras. The product is great, I would recommend the seller to anyone. I just hope this review gets their attention and they reword their product description and what it comes with. Otherwise it would have been Five stars.

Reviews.Title: Crapped Out After a Year
Reviews.Author: T&RW;
Reviews.Content: The camera worked just OK for awhile. It didn't take stellar pictures: the lighting and saturation were often off and the focus was never very sharp. But hey, it was just supposed to be a little point-and-shoot that I could carry around. But then I noticed the battery wasn't holding a charge after about 8 months. I bought a new battery ($$ouch$$), but it was still having problems. Now I have to fight with it to even turn on, and when I do, I often get errors. When it finally turns on, it usually shuts off as soon as I hit the shutter button to take a picture. When it does decide to cooperate and stay on, it will sometimes look like it's taking a picture, but then there's no picture saved. I would say this thing now works maybe 3 times out of 10. Of course, it's out of the 1-year warranty, so no help from Nikon. I'm really disappointed in the product and the service, so I won't be buying from Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: mek
Reviews.Content: Bought this because I have a NIKON DSLR that I like. Owned this camera for about a year and it stopped working. I barely used it. Sent it to NIKON and they quoted $100 to fix. No thanks. For point and shoot, go Canon! Run from NIKON.

Reviews.Title: Fast? no...
Reviews.Author: reginald
Reviews.Content: While picture quality is above average, the speed with which it reliably takes shots varies.  If you are expecting a camera you can just point and shoot, think twice about this one.  I've found that it occasionally "hangs" while I'm pressing the button.  If this is that the camera is recharging to flash or something is out of focus, this is not made plain.  There are better cameras available.  Memory is terrific, movies are OK (no zoom available after mode activation).  Downloading is a breeze.  Just not a moderate action camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: petet
Reviews.Content: The pictures dont turn out very nice, low light are especially bad. Also, I had to ship it back because of a lens error. Now it has a new lens error. Total disappointment. Would not recommend to anyone. I am moving away from Nikon after this, too many bad experiences.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6000 Review
Reviews.Author: Adrian G. Zvarych "Bass Man"
Reviews.Content: Pros: great quality little pocket camera. Decent pictures and zoom features, good close up and pretty good dim light performance. Great stabilization feature. Nice audio video quality as well.The negative goes to Nikon's choice of having a proprietary USB connection for battery charging and picture access. Replacement USB cables are very pricey and usually only available at camera stores carrying the Nikon brand. Cables are much cheaper online and can work great. Even when using Nikon cables for the year I owned the camera, the USB connection at the camera failed just outside the 1 year warranty. Fortunately I'd purchased an extended warranty that covered the repair.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures, Horrid Repair Record
Reviews.Author: MNSnowflake
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the pictures this camera takes, but have had to send it in for lens repairs 4 times in the 11 months since I bought it!  Each time the problem is said to have been fixed, but within a few months I have to send it back.  I think I've only had it in my possession for 7 of those 11 months, due to shipping and repairing.  I don't know if mine is just a fluke or if there are others with these problems, but I would think twice and then three times before buying another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Noggle
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd camera purchase in 11 months. I bought this same camera and dropped it on concrete - ooops! I loved it for the picture quality, ease of use and it's ready to shoot quickly, much better than other models. I preferred to buy this model again over the newer one with the touch screen because it is so easy to adjust your settings without messing up the image area with fingerprints. Super camera as an easy extra camera for fun shots.

Reviews.Title: Beast small Camera ever
Reviews.Author: sony
Reviews.Content: Had this camera previously and lost it in the divorce. When I found this one for this price, even though my ex-wife has taken all my income because she does not have the ability to provide for herself i could get this one.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Gero3898
Reviews.Content: He sido usuario nikon de hace mucho tiempo incluso poseo una D40 y una D90,compre estacamara para mi esposa,  con respecto a esta cámara la imágenes son bastantes clara y nítidas, el gran angular de la cámara para ser compacta esta muy bien en si por ese motivo la compre, con respecto al vídeo también es muy bueno incluso en condiciones de poca luz, la única queja es que es algo delicada en condiciones atmosféricas húmedas ya que el lente se empaña con facilidad

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Tramelia Bolden
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  It's easy to use & takes great photos!  My friends were impressed with the performance.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Psyche
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself for Christmas. Of course, it is not as good as my sister's SLR, but it takes some pretty good pictures, especially outside. Inside it's a bit grainy, but otherwise, I like it!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
